title: movie
text: summer_movies: dataset contains detailed information summer-themed movies, including movie titles, release year, runtime, genres, IMDb rating, number votes. summer_movie_genres: dataset includes genre information associated movie.

title: movie
text: Let’s plot average IMDb ratings Comedy movies time analyze trends.
code: library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  # Filter data for Comedy movies comedy_movies <- summer_movies %>% filter(genres=="comedy") # Plot average rating over time ggplot(comedy_movies, aes(x = year, y = average_rating)) +   geom_line(color = "blue") +   geom_point() +   labs(title = "Average Ratings of Comedy Movies Over Time",        x = "Year", y = "Average Rating")

previous_headings: App Layout > Step-by-Step Guide to Using the App
title: movie
text: Sidebar Panel provides filtering options narrow movie data genre, year range, minimum rating. Genre Dropdown: Select specific genre (e.g., Comedy, Drama) choose “” include movies genres. Use: Select genre dropdown view movies within genre. Choosing “” shows movies every genre. Year Range Slider: Filter movies release year. slider defaults entire range years dataset. Use: Adjust slider set start end years. example, setting 1990 2020 show movies released period. Minimum Rating Slider: Set minimum IMDb rating filter higher-rated movies. Use: Move slider set rating threshold. instance, minimum rating 7 display movies rated 7 . Download Button: Save filtered dataset computer CSV file.
